adverbs.description: unwarrantably (comparative more unwarrantably, superlative most unwarrantably)

entries.meaning: In an unwarrantable manner; in a manner that cannot be justified.
examples: Holiness maketh men meek and patient, and teacheth subjects not to make too great a matter of any injury that is done them; nor to censure unwarrantably the actions of their superiours  […]
